question: What is one reason to click Object > Text Frame Options?
options: to change the number of columns in a text frame
to apply a drop shadow to the frame
to change the corners of a frame from corner to rounded
to change the fill and stroke of a text frame
answer: to change the number of columns in a text frame

question: Which panel allows you to add an arrowhead to the end of a line?
options: Effects
Stroke
Transform
Pathfinder
answer: Stroke

question: In the image shown, what do you know about the Body Text paragraph style?
options: The selected text was not formatted using the style definition.
The selected text is in overset text outside the boundaries of the current frame.
The style has been applied to two or more paragraphs.
The style has been added since the master styles were created.
answer: The selected text was not formatted using the style definition.

question: You want to ensure that an image on your page is exactly 25% of its original size. How can you determine whether the image is set to the desired size?
options: Double-click the image with the Selection tool.
Select the graphic frame with the Selection tool.
Click **Window** > **Info**.
Click **Object** > **Fitting**.
answer: Double-click the image with the Selection tool.

question: You have an empty one-page InDesign document. You have used File > Place to select a Word document that contains many pages of text. What will help you place the full story quickly?
options: Select **Show Import Options** in the **Place** dialog box.
Right-click the page with the place cursor.
Shift-click with the place cursor inside the margin guides.
In the **Pages** panel, click the **New Pages** button with the place cursor.
answer: Shift-click with the place cursor inside the margin guides.

question: You select a graphic frame that contains a Photoshop image and use the Scale field in the Control panel to enlarge it to 200%. What happens to the effective image resolution?
options: The resolution doubles.
Effective image resolution stays the same until you choose from the View > Display Performance menu.
Effective image resolution is set in Photoshop, not in InDesign, so it stays the same.
The resolution is cut in half.
answer: The resolution is cut in half.

question: What is one reason you might want to use the Text Variables feature?
options: to create captions underneath images that update automatically
to include calculations inside a dynamic table
to adjust text size automatically to fill the frame
to create running headers that include chapter names
answer: to create running headers that include chapter names

question: You want to place 4 of a multipage PDF into an InDesign document. What should you do?
options: In the **Place** dialog box, select **Show Import Options**.
Import the PDF with the **Media** panel instead of **File>Place**
Open the PDF in Acrobat, select page 4, and drag it into InDesign.
After placing the PDF, disable the unwanted pages in the Media panel.
answer: In the **Place** dialog box, select **Show Import Options**.

question: Suppose that master page B is based on master page A, and you are currently editing master B. Which statement is true?
options: Objects on master page A are not visible.
Objects on master page A must always appear behind objects from master page B.
Objects on master page A cannot be selected unless you override the objects.
Objects on master page A cannot be selected or changed.
answer: Objects on master page A cannot be selected unless you override the objects.

question: In the image shown, the text is on a path. You want to move the text farther to the right along the path. How can you accomplish this?
options: Drag the blue square D.
Drag the side handle B
Drag the slanted line A.
Drag the center tick mark C.
answer: Drag the slanted line A.

question: When you select a rectangular frame on the page, InDesign displays a yellow square near the frame's upper-right corner. What does this allow you to do?
options: Change the corners from square to round.
Anchor the object into another frame.
Change the layer or z-order of the frame.
Link the frame to another frame.
answer: Change the corners from square to round.

question: What action can the Pen tool perform on a selected object?
options: The Pen tool cannot affect an object after it has been created.
You can click a point to convert it to a curve.
You can drag the Pen tool inside a frame to convert it to a compound shape.
You can click a point to delete it.
answer: You can click a point to delete it.

question: What is one reason you might want to use the Span Columns feature?
options: You have a bullet list of six items that you want to split into two columns in the middle of a text frame.
You are changing the number of columns on a page and want to ensure the text flows properly.
You want a line or top shaded board to span across the top of a multicolumn frame.
You have a heading that you want to span across two threaded text frames
answer: You have a bullet list of six items that you want to split into two columns in the middle of a text frame.

question: Which statement about tables is true?
options: Tables are always anchored in a story in a text frame.
To edit text in a table, you should first click **Table>Convert Table to Text**
Tables must contain more than one cell.
Tables cannot be anchored in a story in a text frame
answer: Tables are always anchored in a story in a text frame.

question: Which feature would you use to create the effect shown, where the grouped circles blend but not the object behind them?
options: Global Light
the Screen blending mode
Isolate Blending
Knockout Group
answer: Isolate Blending

question: In the image shown, what do the colored frame edges indicate?
options: which layer each object is on
which master page each object is on
which object style is applied to the frame
that the red frame is locked
answer: which master page each object is on

question: To resize any frame and its contents and maintain the proportions of both, which key or keys must you press while dragging from a corner handle?
options: Ctrl (Windows) or Command (Mac)
Alt+Shift (Windows) or Option+Shift (Mac)
Ctrl+Shift (Windows) or Command+Shift (Mac)
Alt+Spacebar (Windows) or Options+Spacebar (Mac)
answer: Ctrl+Shift (Windows) or Command+Shift (Mac)

question: In the image shown, what can you infer about how this document will print?
options: The page will be scaled to fit the paper.
All document layers will be visible
Some of the InDesign pages will be cropped off.
The master page P is applied to the document pages.
answer: All document layers will be visible

question: After you click a color stop in the **Gradient** panel to select it, how can you set its color to a swatch in the **Swatches** panel?
options: Double-click the swatch.
Option-click (Mac) or Alt-click (Windows) the swatch.
You cannot apply a color swatch to a color stop in the **Gradient** panel.
Drag the color stop over the color in the **Swatches** panel.
answer: Drag the color stop over the color in the **Swatches** panel.

question: #### 20. Suppose you apply a gradient to a frame, then select New Gradient Swatch in the Swatches panel menu. Which feature is not saved in the gradient swatch?
options: color mode (RGB or CMYK)
color stops
angle
type (linear or radial)
answer: angle

options: Publish online
PDF (Interactive)
EPUB (Fixed Layout)
InDesign Snippet
answer: EPUB (Fixed Layout)

question: #### 22. You create an InDesign document with 1/8" bleed. After laying out the project, the printer calls to say that items in the document do not bleed. What is most likely the problem?
options: You did not extend elements on the page to the bleed guide.
Image objects cannot bleed in InDesign.
Your printer is unable to print with bleed.
You used a color swatch that cannot bleed.
answer: Your printer is unable to print with bleed.

question: #### 23. What are two differences between the PDF/X-1a and the PDF/X-4 PDF export presets?
options: spot colors and bleed values
transparency and RGB images
compression and flattener settings
tagged text and accessibility options
answer: transparency and RGB images

question: #### 24. Suppose you have selected a graphic frame that contains an image. Now you use File > Place and select another photograph. By default, what happens?
options: The new image is placed inside the frame with the original image.
The new image is placed in a new frame in the same location as the original image.
InDesign displays an error.
The new image replaces the original image.
answer: The new image replaces the original image.

question: #### 25. What does the icon to the right of the page thumbnail indicate?
options: The page thumbnail in the Pages panel appears rotated.
The page appears rotated in the document window but will print unrotated.
There are one or more items on this page that are rotated or flagged for rotation.
The page is marked to be rotated when exported or printed.
answer: The page is marked to be rotated when exported or printed.

options: Window > Arrange
View > Screen Mode

View > Extras
answer: Window > Workspace

options: Click Layout > Ruler Guides.

Use the Guides & Pasteboard pane in the Preferences dialog box.

options: Type > Insert White Space

Bleed

options: A, B, D
A, C, E

form fields

question: #### 44. What is the gutter?
options: the distance between a block of type and the frame containing it
- [x] the space between columns and column guides
- [ ] another term for the slug area

options: in Type > Type Variables
the Paragraph panel

Transform
Effects

answer: Media

answer: You want to ensure pages do not get moved out of order.

question: #### 60. Which statement about importing a Microsoft Word document into InDesign is true?
options: Paragraph and character styles are removed and local InDesign formatting is applied.

Paragraph and character styles are mapped automatically when styles are named identically.

answer: Paragraph and character styles are removed and local InDesign formatting is applied.

question: #### 61. You select a frame and click Object > Arrange > Send to Back. The frame still appears above another object on your page. What is the most likely reason?
options: The two objects are on a master page.

options: The Event field must be the same for each object.
The name field must be the same for all the objects.

answer: The name field must be the same for all the objects.

question: #### 63. What is one reason to use a nested line style?

to apply drop caps in the first line of a paragraph

question: #### 64. what does the circled i icon indicate?
options: The field is blank and needs text.

answer: A GREP expression has been attached.

question: #### 65. A tagline that overlaps a graphic disappears when you move an image frame close to it. Why is this happening and how do you fix it?
options: The type is set to `Send to back`, so as soon as you move something next to it, it recedes. Select `Bring to Front` to correct the stacking order.
The image frame needs to be set to `Send to Back` so that it does not interfere with text. Right click the image frame and select `Send to Back`.
The `Display Performance` setting is not set high enough to show type. Click `View > Display Performance > High Quality`.
The image frame has Text Wrap settings in place. Right-click the type in question and select `Text Frame Options > Ignore Text Wrap`.
answer: The image frame has Text Wrap settings in place. Right-click the type in question and select `Text Frame Options > Ignore Text Wrap`.

question: #### 66. After you click a color stop in the `Gradient` panel to select it, how can you set its color to a swatch in the `Swatches` panel?
options: Double-click the swatch.
